title: From low cost plant HMW DNA extraction to MinION sequencing

Grind sample with liquid nitrogen, mortar and pestel to a fine powder.
An analytical grinder (A15, IKA, Germany) can also be used for 2x

source.body:
Optionnal:
If the supernatant is not clear, add of and agitate slowly manually or with horizontal shaker .
Centrifuge and carefully transfer the supernatant to a clean 50 ml tube by using a 1000µl pipette tip cut at the extremity..

source.body: To avoid DNA shearing, always cut tip extremities using a clean razor blade before pipetting.

source.description: Quantify 1µl of DNA using a Qubit fluorometer.

source.title: Check HMW using Pulsed-Field Gel Electrophoresis

source.description:
Molecular weight of extracted DNA was assessed by PFGE by loading
of DNA (
to
of DNA,
of 6x loading buffer) and
into 1% agarose gel and using the following parameters for migration:
Pulse time : initial = 5, final = 120
Run time = 18 h
V/cm = 5
Angle = 120
Temp = 14°
mA end of run = 255

source.name: Lambda Ladder PFG Marker - 50 gel lanes

source.description:
Perform short read elimination with a 25Kb cut-off by following the Circulomics SRE kit (SKUSS-100-101-01) instructions.
Incubate
at
in elution buffer before Qubit quantification and library preparation.

SQK-LSK109 library preparation is performed according to
protocol with several modifications :

DNA repair & end-prep
In a 1.5ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube mix:
DNA sample (9µg of extracted DNA with volume adjusted with 50/50 Ultrapure water/TE pH8)
NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Buffer
Ultra II End-prep Reaction Buffer
Ultra II End-prep Enzyme Mix
Mix by gently flicking the tube, and spin down.
Using a thermal cycler, incubate at
for
and
for
.
Resuspend the
equilibrated at room temperature by vortexing.
Add
of
to the end-prep reaction and mix by gently flicking the tube.
Incubate
at
.
Meanwhile, prepare
of 70% ethanol using nuclease-free water.
After the incubation, spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.
Wash the beads twice with
of freshly-prepared 70% ethanol.
Spin down and place the tube back on the magnet to pipette off the residual ethanol.
Remove the tube from the magnet and resuspend the pellet in
nuclease-free water.
Incubate
at
and
at
. Gently flick the tube and incubate
more at
.
Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless.
Remove and retain
of eluate into a clean 1.5ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.
Quantify
of eluted sample using a Qubit fluorometer.

source.name: NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Mix - 24 rxns

source.description:
Adapter ligation
In a 1.5ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube, mix:
DNA sample from the previous step
Ligation Buffer (LNB)
NEBNext Quick T4 DNA Ligase
Adapter Mix (AMX)
Mix by gently flicking the tube, and spin down.
Incubate the reaction for
at
Resuspend the
equilibrated
by vortexing.
Add
of
to the end-prep reaction and mix by gently flicking the tube.
Incubate
at
.
Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.
Wash the beads by adding
of Long Fragment Buffer (LFB) at room temperature. Remove the supernatant and repeat the wash step.
Spin down and place the tube back on the magnet to pipette off the residual LFB.
Remove the tube from the magnet and resuspend the pellet in
of Elution Buffer (EB).
Incubate
at
and

.
Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless.
Remove and retain
of eluate into a clean 0.5ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.
Quantify
of eluted sample using a Qubit fluorometer.

Split the 16µl library into two 8µl in 0.5ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube. Store one tube at
until use.

Day 1 - First Load
In the second tube, add to the 8µl library:
Elution buffer (EB)
Sequencing buffer (SQB)
Loading beads (LB), mixed immediately before use.
Using MinION mk1C device, perform the flow cell check. (FLO-MIN106D - Spot-ON Flow Cell R9 version)
Prepare the priming mix by adding
of Flush tether (FLT) directly into a fresh Flush buffer (FB) tube.
Mix by vortexing.
After opening the priming port, check for a small air bubble under the cover. Draw back a small volume to
remove any bubbles (a few μl):
- Set a P1000 pipette to 200 μl
- Insert the tip into the priming port
- Turn the wheel until the dial shows 220-230 μl, or until you can see a small volume of buffer entering the
pipette tip.
Load
of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port, avoiding the introduction of air
bubbles. Wait for
.
Remove again any bubbles :
- Set a P1000 pipette to 200 μl
- Insert the tip into the priming port
- Turn the wheel until the dial shows 220-230 μl, or until you can see a small volume of buffer entering the
pipette tip.
Gently open the SpotON sample port.
Load an additional 200 µl of the priming mix into the still open priming port.
Mix the prepared library gently by pipetting up and down just prior to loading.
Slowly, add
of the library into the SpotON sample port.
Make sure the priming port is still open during this step and the library should easily fall into the sample port.
Close the priming port and replace the SpotON sample port cover.
Close the lid of the MinION device.
Start the sequencing experiment by setting a 96h run.

Day 3 - Second Load
After 48h running, pause the sequencing run.
Perform the flow cell washing step according to the ONT protocol (EXP-WSH003).
At the end of this protocol, re-prime the flow cell as indicated in the 10.1 step.
In the 8µl library tube stored at 4°C, add the following:
Elution buffer (EB)
Sequencing buffer (SQB)
Loading beads (LB), mixed immediately before use.
Load on the flow cell as the 10.1 step.
Resume the sequencing run.

source.body:
The wash kit allows to revert "unavailable pores" into "active pores".
This procedure provides the opportunity to maximise the flow cell yield.

After 72h running, if translocation speed falls below 250 bases per seconde, pause the run and refuel:
After opening the priming port, check for a small air bubble under the cover. Draw back a small volume to
remove any bubbles (a few μl):
- Set a P1000 pipette to 200 μl
- Insert the tip into the priming port
- Turn the wheel until the dial shows 220-230 μl, or until you can see a small volume of buffer entering the pipette tip.
Load of Flush Buffer (FB). Close the priming port and resume the run.

description: This low cost protocol is efficient to extract high molecular weight DNA from several tropical plants to prepare LSK109 libraries for Nanopore sequencing. Pulsed-field gel electrophoresis reveals a DNA size range from 40 to 350 Kb for four species of rice, Paspalum, date palm and Ocotea obtusata. Sequencing on MinION Nanopore flow cells yielded from 3.3 to 25.3 Gb with reads N50 values ranging from 15.4 to 31.3 Kb.
